thread.title: Cold front coming into San Angelo, Abilene soon
thread.title_full: Cold front coming into San Angelo, Abilene soon

title: Cold front coming into San Angelo, Abilene soon
text:
By Rosanna Fraire, San Angelo Standard-Times ,
11 hours ago Fallout from the polar vortex is expected to hit as soon as Sunday with winter temperatures in tow.
San Angelo and Abilene are expected to get a cold front early next week with lower temperatures in the 20s.
"A strong cold front will move through west central Texas Sunday bringing much colder air into the area," according to a Facebook post on Thursday from the National Weather Service . "Expect above normal temperatures through Saturday before the front."
Adam Wiley, NWS meteorologist, said Thursday that the cold front is expected to hit Sunday afternoon and last through Wednesday.
Temperatures will be below normal with temperatures below freezing likely each night.
"That'll give us colder weather looking right now with highs in the 40s and lows in the mid-20s," Wiley said. "This will potentially be the coldest temperatures we've seen so far this winter especially at night."
The NWS forecast only looks ahead for seven days. Snow is currently not in the forecast for San Angelo and Abilene.
"Right now in our forecast, we don't have any precipitation," Wiley said. "That can obviously change between now and then, but the main thing right now is the colder temperatures. We could potentially be down into the teens next week."
NWS seven day forecast Friday : Sunny, with a high near 65. Calm wind becoming east around 5 mph in the afternoon.
Friday night : Partly cloudy with a low around 47. East wind around 5 mph becoming south after midnight.
Saturday : Partly sunny with a high near 70. South wind 5 to 10 mph increasing to 10 to 15 mph in the afternoon. Winds could gust as high as 30 mph.
Saturday night : Partly cloudy with a low around 49. South wind around 10 mph with gusts as high as 20 mph.
Sunday : Sunny with a high near 63. West wind 10 to 15 mph becoming north in the afternoon. Winds could gust as high as 25 mph.
Sunday night : Mostly clear with a low around 27. Northeast wind 5 to 10 mph.
Monday : Sunny with a high near 49. North to northeast wind 5 to 10 mph.
Monday night : Partly cloudy with a low around 26. East to northeast wind around 5 mph.
Tuesday : Mostly sunny with a high near 46.
Tuesday night : Mostly cloudy with a low around 26.
Wednesday : Partly sunny with a high near 44.

This article originally appeared on San Angelo Standard-Times: Cold front coming into San Angelo, Abilene soon
